static replaceAllEntities ( $  string) [static]

Replace all entities.

This will scan a string and will attempt to replace all entities with their numeric equivalent. This will not work with specialized entities.

Parameters:
string$stringThe string to perform replacements on.
Returns:
string Returns a string that is similar to the original one, but with all entity replacements made.

Member Data Documentation

$regex = '/&([\w]+);|&#([\d]+);|&#(x[0-9a-fA-F]+);|(&)/m' [static, protected]

This is three regexes wrapped into 1.

The | divides them. 1: Match any char-based entity. This will go in $matches[1] 2: Match any num-based entity. This will go in $matches[2] 3: Match any hex-based entry. This will go in $matches[3] 4: Match any ampersand that is not an entity. This goes in $matches[4] This last rule will only match if one of the previous two has not already matched. XXX: Are octal encodings for entities acceptable?
